newsitem.title: USA: Living Centers, GranCare up on deal.
newsitem.headline: Living Centers, GranCare up on deal.

text.p: Shares in Living Centers of America Inc and GranCare Inc both traded sharply higher Thursday afternoon following their midday announcement of a complex, $1.8 billion merger agreement.

Traders said investors are buying into the deal because of high-profile financier Leon Black, who, through Apollo Management LP, will invest $200 million to acquire almost five million newly-issued Living Centers shares in a recapitalization that is part of the transaction.
"Leon Black still has a mystique about him and that helps, though I have not figured out the financials yet," said an arbitrageur who declined to be named.
By midafternoon, GranCare shares soared 19.3 percent, or 1-1/2 points, to 9-1/4, while LCA rose 4.5 percent, or 1-5/8, to 38-1/8.
Upon execution of the deal, the new company would be about 39.3-percent owned by Apollo, 11.2-percent owned by Living Centers shareholders 49.5 percent owned by GranCare holders, the parties said.

"It looks like a leveraged recapitalization, via an infusion from Apollo, then the acquisition of LCA. I think LCA effectively is being acquired in what looks like an LBO," according to a second arb who declined to be named.
The parties in the deal said the transaction will create the second-largest long-term care provider in the country, operating over 330 facilities with more than 38,000 beds in 21 states.
